intro: Crepidomanes tiendongense, commonly known as the Tiendong sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of East Asia, particularly China. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
